Enjoy the training lead We are working hard to bring you the best IT training courses.

Google Cloud Platform

Google Cloud Platform enables developers to build, test and deploy applications on Google’s highly-scalable and reliable infrastructure. Read more

Official Course: includes the official exam to become a Google Cloud Platform Qualified Developer, emitted by Google.

Spring

The official courses about the portfolio of products that have become the de facto standard for the development of Java applications. Read more

Official Course: includes the official exam to become a Certified Spring Developer, emitted by Pivotal.

Official Training Partners

Get the natural advantage from consulting Join the list of clients that are relying on our consulting and mentoring services.

Aena Air Navigation Messaging System During this 1-year project a team with no prior experience was formed to develop a real-time messaging system for air navigation messages that connects 10+ data sources with error recovery.

Vessel Traffic System A team was created from scratch for this six-month project to develop a system that could control the maritime traffic of the coast of Poland, including 20+ different types of navigation alarms (hazards, collisions, restricted areas) and the integration of multiple real-time detection systems (radar, video, goniometer..) with a NoSQL back-end.

Architecture for application development This one-year project redesigned the architecture to migrate existing systems to a Spring-based platform. This project included a team of six architects, two of them from the bank.

E-banking platform Development of the e-banking platform for the private banking branch of BBVA. This project includes the full development of a web front-end that enables access to user assets, including real-time reports of portfolio positions. The final product includes the integration of a complex security platform based on state-of-the-art authentication systems.

Web technologies training The Office of the High Commissioner of Human Rights of the United Nations has received an intensive series of training courses on HTML5 and CSS3 technologies to better support their Intranet and Extranet sites.
